text: sys(Question): how are yo usr: Good how are you sys(Question): ok. thanks for asking. what on your mind usr: Just been having a rough time....recently broke up with my girlfriend. sys(Restatement or Paraphrasing): sounds hard. are you doing anything to help usr: Trying to avoid thoughts about her, but every where on social media she is posting about her new guy. It is hard to escape the sadness. sys(Restatement or Paraphrasing): wow. in our connected world it is hard to get away. do you want to tell me how it happened usr: Yeah it is. text: usr: Hello, how are you?
label: ['Question']

text: usr: Hello, how are you? sys(Question): Hi there, how are you feeling? usr: I'm alright, honestly I'm feeling rather ashamed. The reason for that and the problem that I'm facing is that I've had a drinking problem for quite a few years now, and I'm only 24 years old. Right now in my life I'm ready to seek help, but I'm having a lot of anxiety about it because I'm very worried about how others will judge me. I'm worried about how the counselors will see me, how others at a facility might view me, and any one else that I will have to share my story with when getting treatment and how they might view me. I'm ashamed of myself, my life, and the choices that I've made that have gotten me here and I guess my problem is that I just dont know how to get over these extreme anxieties and worries so that I can just finally make the step that I need so desperately and get help.
label: ['Self-disclosure', 'Providing Suggestions', 'Question']

So you are saying that you are not sure what career to study? usr: I do have an idea about it but I am anxious about choosing wrong and boxing myself into something I wish I hadn't chosen sys(Providing Suggestions): Even if you chose wrong, you will generally have plenty of time to make up your mind and choose something that you really like : ), plus, you can reach out to academic advisors, for example. usr: I suppose you're right, I think I don't have confidence in myself that what ever I do choose, I will be good at it. Good enough to make a life out of it. fear of failing myself because i lose interest in things over time sys(Self-disclosure): I myself lose interest in many things quite frequently. usr: but what if that thing is your career choice? sys(Information, Providing Suggestions): That is a totally normal aspect of human nature. It's normal to get bored of things even if we really liked them at some point Of course, some topics like those are more serious, but as I said, even if you chosed wrong ,you can always change your major. usr: I guess thats right. All I care about is helping others so as long as the choice i make supports that then it will be fine. thank you for your help sys(Affirmation and Reassurance, Self-disclosure): No problem, and it's great that you like helping others. I am a firm believer that ultimately making others happy is what makes us happy. usr: yes, it is very rewarding to do so, it should be a part of everyone's life choices i agree with you on that sys(Providing Suggestions, Question): Remember to always keep a positive mindset. I am sure you will sort this out in no time. Is there anything else I can help you with today? usr: I am sure you are right, I just get caught up in my thoughts too much. have a great day! no thank you are you still there sys(Providing Suggestions, Others): Yes, sorry And it has been a pleasure : ) usr: why does it say im ending the chat early when it has been enough time already
label: ['Others']

text: usr: Hello. Feeling low today.

text: usr: Hello. Feeling low today. sys(Question): Thank you for reaching out. Tell me more about it. usr: I've been remote working for the entire pandemic. At first, it was great. I didn't go into the office very often before, so I felt relief from feeling any obligation to do so. But now I wonder if I am presenting myself well if my clients and coworkers have so much less personal interaction.
label: ['Restatement or Paraphrasing']

text: usr: Hello. Feeling low today. sys(Question): Thank you for reaching out. Tell me more about it. usr: I've been remote working for the entire pandemic. At first, it was great. I didn't go into the office very often before, so I felt relief from feeling any obligation to do so. But now I wonder if I am presenting myself well if my clients and coworkers have so much less personal interaction. sys(Restatement or Paraphrasing): yeah I agree. This pandemic has really been weighing on us. As it pertains to work, you feel like the lacking of personal interaction has distanced yourself and colleagues and you feel like there is an increasingly large barrier given the physical constraint? usr: Yes. I can be terse and maybe even come across as confrontational online. But when I interact in person, we share so more - body language, facial expressions, we don't have as much of a time constraint. I feel like a lot of my value may be overshadowed by unfavorable impressions.
label: ['Others']

text: usr: Hello. Feeling low today. sys(Question): Thank you for reaching out. Tell me more about it. usr: I've been remote working for the entire pandemic. At first, it was great. I didn't go into the office very often before, so I felt relief from feeling any obligation to do so. But now I wonder if I am presenting myself well if my clients and coworkers have so much less personal interaction. sys(Restatement or Paraphrasing): yeah I agree. This pandemic has really been weighing on us. As it pertains to work, you feel like the lacking of personal interaction has distanced yourself and colleagues and you feel like there is an increasingly large barrier given the physical constraint? usr: Yes. I can be terse and maybe even come across as confrontational online. But when I interact in person, we share so more - body language, facial expressions, we don't have as much of a time constraint. I feel like a lot of my value may be overshadowed by unfavorable impressions. sys(Others): Can you tell me more about your work responsibilities - is it of a customer service nature? It would help me understand your situation better. I can relate to words vs. the combination of facial expression, body language, etc. The single channel of communication has stripped a lot of meaning and value and has made performance a lot more difficult. The transition is challenging and the uncertainty of the future also adds to the stress. usr: Yes, it is of customer service nature. I provide expertise and technical products. I often advise others who do not have the same level of knowledge. I have to convey ideas that may seem quite abstract. Challenging face-to-face, and I have fewer online tools to help share knowledge in a meaningful way.
label: ['Affirmation and Reassurance', 'Reflection of feelings']

text: sys(Question): Hello! What can I do to help? usr: Hello, I'm not sure if there is any help? Without knowing when I can return to work, I will probably remain anxious about the unknown sys(Restatement or Paraphrasing): I'm glad to speak to you today. (2) sys(Affirmation and Reassurance, Providing Suggestions): That's a fare worry but you can't be discourged. YOu need to think positively. You can use this as a time to reconnect with family and to get your resume together. usr: I will have to do a new resume definitely. It's been awhile. (3)
label: ['Question']

text: usr: Hello sys(Others): Hi, how are you feeling today? usr: I am not feeling the best. I have been having some depression, because of not being able to see friends and family during this pandemic.
label: ['Question']

text: usr: Hello sys(Others): Hi, how are you feeling today? usr: I am not feeling the best. I have been having some depression, because of not being able to see friends and family during this pandemic. sys(Question): Oh, boy, do I know that feeling! How are you dealing with it? (if I may ask) usr: I try to message them as much as possible and call them on the phone but it is just not the same as actually getting to give the a hug and see them in person.
label: ['Question']

text: usr: Hello sys(Others): Hi, how are you feeling today? usr: I am not feeling the best. I have been having some depression, because of not being able to see friends and family during this pandemic. sys(Question): Oh, boy, do I know that feeling! How are you dealing with it? (if I may ask) usr: I try to message them as much as possible and call them on the phone but it is just not the same as actually getting to give the a hug and see them in person. sys(Question): I know that. I use Zoom, just to see them...do you have a computer? usr: Yes. That works for some of my family but I have family in the nursing home that does not have access to computers. I haven't seen them in several months. It just breaks my heart.
label: ['Affirmation and Reassurance']

text: usr: Hello sys(Others): Hi, how are you feeling today? usr: I am not feeling the best. I have some very dear friends that have helped me a lot. I guess the depression is just worse because it is the holidays and this is the first year that I haven't got to spend it with my extended family members.
label: ['Self-disclosure']

I think I will try to find a good podcast or a good comedy series that I like and spend time doing that. It's hard to be sad when you are watching something funny or listening to something funny. Thank you for the good advice and the listening ear. sys(Reflection of feelings): I wish that I could listen to more....this thing is so slow. I guess we tend to feel guilty if we feel happy since there is so much sadness in the world right now. But you are so right about the fact that we will come out on the other side. It helps to remember that bad things don't last forever. sys(Providing Suggestions): Yes, and are you somewhere where you can walk or exercise a bit? I always feel better if I can move around...dance...something active. What I find helps me the most is to remember that we need to stay safe and be OK, so that we will be here to celebrate when this is over. usr: Yes. I live in the country so I can go for nice walks when the weather is nice. When do you move? usr: I am moving in a month, but there is just so much to do before then. sys(Providing Suggestions): I see. What is your wind-down routine like in the evening, if you have one? usr: I usually put my kids to bed and then try to relax for about an hour while I watch tv before I head to bed. sys(Reflection of feelings): Oh you're a parent AND you are moving, you have a lot on your plate! usr: Yes, I am a homeschooling mother of two. sys(Providing Suggestions, Providing Suggestions): Have you tried a warm bath before bed? that's helped me before. Meditation to still my mind before sleeping helps too. I've read that a small carb snack before bed, like a peice of toast, is supposed to help us fall asleep, I haven't tried it though usr: A bath does sound really relaxing. I have tried some meditations. sys(Providing Suggestions): One thing I highly recommend is a podcast called "Tracks to Relax" usr: Thanks, I will have to try that. Music does tend to calm me down. I don't know why I haven't tried that. sys(Information, Information): It's guided sleep meditations, and his voice is incredibly soothing....works well for me on nights I can't naturally fall asleep. He leads you relaxing walks into the forest and such things, it's very peaceful usr: I really appreciate that help, I will try it for sure. I think it will be easier to focus on a meditation with someone talking me through it sys(Question): Have you a partner sharing the childrearing? usr: Yes, but he has already moved to our new house because he is working on floors and stuff to get it ready. So I have been alone to stew in my worries. sys(Restatement or Paraphrasing, Providing Suggestions): Oh I see so right now you're the main "parent-er"? Do you have other family that could take the kids for a wekend so you can have a proper rest? usr: Yes, I am. But, my children are not very stressful. I think they help more than anything. I have wonderful children. I think it is just the thoughts of moving to a new place and the actual 20 hour drive in a moving truck that is scaring me. I really appreciate your support today. It is helpful to talk it out. Your suggestions were also really good.
label: ['Affirmation and Reassurance']

text: sys(Others): Hello usr: Hello, I am looking for help in managing some depression.
label: ['Affirmation and Reassurance', 'Question']

text: sys(Others): Hello usr: Hello, I am looking for help in managing some depression. sys(Affirmation and Reassurance, Question): You've come to a good place to start. Is there something in particular that is leaving you feeling depressed? usr: I am feeling resentful towards my husband for quitting his job, and my son for being the reason that he quit his job. My son's behavior is causing a lot of conflict in our house and my husband not working is putting a lot of financial stress on us
label: ['Restatement or Paraphrasing']

text: sys(Others): Hello usr: Hello, I am looking for help in managing some depression. sys(Affirmation and Reassurance, Question): You've come to a good place to start. Is there something in particular that is leaving you feeling depressed? usr: I am feeling resentful towards my husband for quitting his job, and my son for being the reason that he quit his job. My son's behavior is causing a lot of conflict in our house and my husband not working is putting a lot of financial stress on us sys(Restatement or Paraphrasing): I'm sorry to hear that. Feeling resentment for both your husband's loss of work and your son's loss of his job is entirely understandable. usr: I have a hard time not dwelling on the negative things going on. It's hard to see anything positive or feel hopeful for the future.
label: ['Self-disclosure', 'Reflection of feelings']

text: sys(Others): Hello usr: Hello, I am looking for help in managing some depression. sys(Affirmation and Reassurance, Question): You've come to a good place to start. Is there something in particular that is leaving you feeling depressed? usr: I am feeling resentful towards my husband for quitting his job, and my son for being the reason that he quit his job. My son's behavior is causing a lot of conflict in our house and my husband not working is putting a lot of financial stress on us sys(Restatement or Paraphrasing): I'm sorry to hear that. Feeling resentment for both your husband's loss of work and your son's loss of his job is entirely understandable. usr: I have a hard time not dwelling on the negative things going on. It's hard to see anything positive or feel hopeful for the future. sys(Self-disclosure, Reflection of feelings): I have an adult son who also lost his job recently, and I understand the added stress that can cause in your household. That is a really difficult position to be in. usr: My son is very defiant and argues with us about everything we try and get him to do, but he expects us to give him money for fun things that he wants to do when he isn't willing to work or even help out around the house
label: ['Providing Suggestions']

text: sys(Others): Hello usr: Hello, I am looking for help in managing some depression. sys(Affirmation and Reassurance, Question): You've come to a good place to start. text: sys(Others): Hello usr: Hello, I am looking for help in managing some depression. sys(Affirmation and Reassurance, Question): You've come to a good place to start. Is there something in particular that is leaving you feeling depressed? usr: I am feeling resentful towards my husband for quitting his job, and my son for being the reason that he quit his job. My son's behavior is causing a lot of conflict in our house and my husband not working is putting a lot of financial stress on us sys(Restatement or Paraphrasing): I'm sorry to hear that. Feeling resentment for both your husband's loss of work and your son's loss of his job is entirely understandable. usr: I have a hard time not dwelling on the negative things going on. It's hard to see anything positive or feel hopeful for the future. sys(Self-disclosure, Reflection of feelings): I have an adult son who also lost his job recently, and I understand the added stress that can cause in your household. That is a really difficult position to be in. usr: My son is very defiant and argues with us about everything we try and get him to do, but he expects us to give him money for fun things that he wants to do when he isn't willing to work or even help out around the house sys(Providing Suggestions): Regardless of what your husband's actions are and your son's, could you possibly make the time to do things to support yourself, that even momentarily would provide you with some positive feelings? usr: I try to go for a run every night, that does help. sys(Reflection of feelings): That is very hard emotionally, so I am sorry you have to deal with your son's behavior. usr: It is hard to keep my emotions separate from what is going on with him sys(Providing Suggestions, Affirmation and Reassurance): That is very understandable! Setting boundaries for yourself may help. Even when it's difficult, being clear with your son that you will not be giving him money could help. Sometimes being clear with your own expectations can help him to see what won't be accepted from him as long as he is living in your home. usr: Yes, I could do better at that. I want him to have fun and do things with friends, but I want him to be willing to work for what he wants, too. I do struggle with expectations. I want him to be someone that he is not willing to be, I need to let go of that and just let him be himself and not base my emotions on his choices.
label: ['Restatement or Paraphrasing']

text: sys(Others): Hello! usr: Hello sys(Question): Is there anything you'd like to talk about today? usr: Yes,i feel like i am in depsression. sys(Question): Im sorry to hear that. What do you think may have led up to these feelings of being depressed?? usr: My partner broke up with me impromptu
label: ['Reflection of feelings', 'Self-disclosure']

text: sys(Others): Hello! usr: Hello sys(Question): Is there anything you'd like to talk about today? usr: Yes,i feel like i am in depsression. sys(Question): Im sorry to hear that. What do you think may have led up to these feelings of being depressed?? usr: My partner broke up with me impromptu sys(Reflection of feelings, Self-disclosure): Oh dear, yes that can be incredibly hard to deal with. Relationships are so full of emotion that when they end it can feel like chaos or despair. Ive been through a few bad breakups myself in the past so i know how you must be feeling right now. usr: Exactly,that is my current situation.I feel like my entire life has been rearranged How did you deal with them and specifically what was your coping mechanism?
label: ['Affirmation and Reassurance', 'Self-disclosure']

text: sys(Others): Hello! usr: Hello sys(Question): Is there anything you'd like to talk about today? usr: Yes,i feel like i am in depsression. sys(Question): Im sorry to hear that. What do you think may have led up to these feelings of being depressed?? usr: My partner broke up with me impromptu sys(Reflection of feelings, Self-disclosure): Oh dear, yes that can be incredibly hard to deal with. Relationships are so full of emotion that when they end it can feel like chaos or despair. Ive been through a few bad breakups myself in the past so i know how you must be feeling right now. usr: Exactly,that is my current situation.I feel like my entire life has been rearranged How did you deal with them and specifically what was your coping mechanism? sys(Affirmation and Reassurance, Self-disclosure): Well to be honest in some ways your life has been rearranged, but thats okay. Its not EASY, but it is okay, or rather will be okay. experiencing life is just a big bunch of rearrangements that we learn to adapt to and grow from and even out of. Its what gives us depth and character as human beings. HA, well at first i cried and was mad and just moped and hated everything, but eventually i got tired of no getting anything out of my days. I slowly realised that i had put myself in slow motion and then slowly started to do things i used to do to maybe come out of it. usr: True,what ways would you suggest i use to approach my situation and get out of this state? It is very pathetic really when you think of it,halting all your life activities and plans just because a relationship ended.
label: ['Providing Suggestions']

It get's frustrating when I always look a mess. sys(Reflection of feelings, Question): Oh I could see that being frustrating, if you can't keep them neat. is your hair short or long? usr: It is long. sys(Providing Suggestions, Question): have you thought of having it shorter, it might be easier to tame? Just a thought....you say you always look like a mess...is that your personal opinion or has anyone else commented on your hair? usr: I started to cut it shorter last time, but my stylist said it would be big. It is hard to find the right product. It is my personal opinion. sys(Providing Suggestions): have you asked a friend for an honest opinion? usr: My friend likes my hair, but also says she can see that it is hard to manage. sys(Self-disclosure): I know I am my own worst enemy when it comes to my own appearance. usr: I can totally relate to that. I think we always want what we dont have. sys(Providing Suggestions, Self-disclosure, Question): One thing I have started doing, since my hair hasn't been cut for a year due to pandemic, is wearing hats. my hair is driving me crazy, so I get your frustration Is it long enough to braid? usr: I went a year without cutting mine as well for the same reason. That is probably why it felt so out of control now that you say that. Now that I am vaccinated I just got it cut. Maybe I will like it better now. Yes, I do like braids. That is a good idea. sys(Others): yay! a haircut!!! Congrats usr: Thank you. It does make it feel a little better. I hope you can get yours cut soon too. sys(Providing Suggestions, Self-disclosure): one last suggestion: ask more stylists' opinions perhaps? oh thankyou....had my shot yesterday....now I have to wait for our lockdown to expire (May 20) so I have a bit more shag to go usr: Yes, good idea. It seems it has been so long to be able to do this. Maybe I need to think of a new style. Had my second shot last Thursday so I hope opportunities like a new stylist happen soon. sys(Providing Suggestions): Have you googled images for short curly hairstyles? usr: I will look on Pinterest. Good idea. sys(Others, Affirmation and Reassurance): Second shot congrats!! Very exciting. Pinterest is a great source for hairstyles as I recall...there are boards and boards of them. Good idea! usr: Thank you. I can't believe how relieved I feel knowing I've had it. Sick for a couple days but worth it. Now I will feel like looking at pinterest more. Maybe you are right and I need something new and fresh.
label: ['Others']

text: usr: Hello I was wondering if I can discuss the effects of the pandemic have on my mental health. sys(Others, Question): Hello How has the pandemic affected your mental health? usr: Well, right now my city is undergoing a second wave and it was doing very well so far, but in the past two weeks, have been a slow and steady surge of daily cases. Just feeling stress and fear from the second wave. sys(Self-disclosure, Affirmation and Reassurance, Affirmation and Reassurance): I understand how hard living through this pandemic is. It is such crazy time! I also have felt fear and stress from the second wave of the pandemic. It is natural to feel stressed when there is a global pandemic. I am sure with the correct coping strategies you can handle this pandemic! usr: yeah it's crazy. I am starting to feel paranoid and stressed everytime I go out for groceries. I work once or twice a week outside of the home and I generally get groceries once every two weeks, but my guard is up again, ever since the first wave was gone by the end of summer. I am also sorry to hear that you have stress from this. I sympathize fully. sys(Self-disclosure): I have been doing grocery pick-up because of the pandemic, so I sympathize with you. usr: Thank you for the positive message and believing in me. sys(Providing Suggestions): Wearing a mask and using hand sanitizer can keep you safe and healthy while grocery shopping. usr: grocery pick-up, that's not a bad coping mechanism. I don't know, I don't want to spend the extra money for the special handling though, plus I just feel paranoid having someone touch my groceries. But that's just me. sanitizer I should probably get, just a disposable one to keep on me at all times. sys(Information): Practicing mindfulness and going on a short walk in nature can help with your stress. usr: yes that would help I suppose, just that I stopped going out, to the gym, movies, anything frivolous ever since the pandemic started. sys(Information): At some grocery stores, they have made pick-up free due to the pandemic. You should look into that if you are interested in it. usr: My life was put on a pause and I still can't believe it's november already. sys(Self-disclosure): I also have stopped going out since the pandemic started. usr: ok, I will look into the grocery method. sys(Reflection of feelings, Question): Just from chatting with you, you seem to be very open to suggestions and are devoted to making it through these crazy times. Has your work life been affected by the pandemic? usr: so literally, I only go out for a purpose, meaning special errands like groceries and personal administrative tasks, banking, work, and only that. work life, let me think I only started a new work in September, and it's not much (about two days a week), so I can't comment too much about that. It is stressful seeing more people than usual outside of my home and in such close quarters sys(Self-disclosure): Yes, I also only go out for groceries and work. I only work with a few people, so that helps. usr: so I get nervous in general when I am at work but I do my work just the same. May not be able to work as well because I have to breathe through a mask, and some other small difficulties. sys(Affirmation and Reassurance): That is good that you can continue to do your work the same. usr: Thank you for all the positive messages so far and in understanding and sympathizing with me. sys(Question): Is there anything else I should know about how the pandemic is affecting you? usr: pretty much. If anything, it's my academic life at home that has changed not so well. sys(Question): Are you a student? usr: yes, I take online courses and I tend to procrastinate a lot more and get distracted as I find myself more and more at home. Just getting carried away and now have impending deadlines. I can get through it but it has had a toll on my productivity. I was just taking my sweet time with it and that wasn't good sys(Self-disclosure, Providing Suggestions, Information, Information): I am also a student and am not motivated to do school work at home, so I completely understand. I am sure you are successful at school! Having a planner may keep you organized and on-task. Dedicating a certain time frame and area for school work might help, as well. Dedicating a certain time frame and area for school work might help, as well. usr: Because prior to the pandemic, I was pretty regimented with set schedules and can clear my mind with work-outs and going to the gym and movies, but now it's not that simple. sys(Question): Is there anything else I can help you with? usr: Thank you and I hope your schooling goes well also. sys(Others): Thank you, you too! usr: yeah I like your idea of dedicating the time. I find that I am slacking off and being disorganized in areas like time management. So yes I have to improve on that. I suppose you have been doing your schooling relatively better in your situation? I hope you do anyhow sys(Question): Great ideas! Is there anything else I can help you with? usr: would you have any other advice on how to overcome things like time management with academics? like how to avoid procrastination? Because this was so much better in the past that I just had set schedules and can clear my mind by going out, etc. and feeling refreshed and feeling the urgency to study again. But that's gone for me now. sys(Providing Suggestions): I would reccomend setting deadlines in your planner of when tasks need to be completed and also setting timers for 20 minutes at a time where you have to focus for that long before you can do any other task. usr: Great, I think that's a good area for me to go into. Timers and set agendas sys(Affirmation and Reassurance): Yes! usr: like a timetable when they used to hand out when I used to be in high school, let's say and this hour I do this, etc. and as you say, yoga or work out in between all great ideas I think

text: usr: I'm qualified for a promotion but my boss is refusing to promote me based on biased feedback he has received from someone else sys(Restatement or Paraphrasing): It sounds like you are having a hard time because your boss isn't willing to consider you for a promotion, is that right? usr: Yes that's right. It's frustratgn *frustrating
label: ['Self-disclosure']

text: usr: I'm qualified for a promotion but my boss is refusing to promote me based on biased feedback he has received from someone else sys(Restatement or Paraphrasing): It sounds like you are having a hard time because your boss isn't willing to consider you for a promotion, is that right? usr: Yes that's right. It's frustratgn *frustrating sys(Self-disclosure): Have you talked to anyone else at work about it? Promotions are a bit of a sensitive issue

text: sys(Question): Hello how are you doing today? usr: Am ok but feeling sad and anxious
label: ['Restatement or Paraphrasing']

text: sys(Question): Hello how are you doing today? usr: Am ok but feeling sad and anxious sys(Restatement or Paraphrasing): I'm sorry to hear that you are sad and anxious. Do you know what is causing you to feel that way? usr: Yes. I recently lost my childhood best friend to covid 19.
label: ['Restatement or Paraphrasing']

text: sys(Question): Hello how are you doing today? usr: Am ok but feeling sad and anxious sys(Restatement or Paraphrasing): I'm sorry to hear that you are sad and anxious. Do you know what is causing you to feel that way? usr: Yes. I recently lost my childhood best friend to covid 19. sys(Restatement or Paraphrasing): I can only imagine how sad you feel from losing your best friend. Hopefully chatting some will help. I know in the past when I lost someone it was nice to just have a conversation to help put my mind at ease. usr: Sure. I feel so lonely sometimes because we were very close.
label: ['Providing Suggestions']

text: usr: Hello, I've been really depressed lately and feel like there isn't anything I can do to break this feeling.
label: ['Question']

text: usr: Hello, I've been really depressed lately and feel like there isn't anything I can do to break this feeling. sys(Question): Can you tell me what happened? usr: November before Covid started I was diagnoses with CRPS (its a nerve issue that causes immense pain) and had to stop doing my activities like dance, then when Covid hit last March and we all had to isolate I have not been able to interact with people outside my immediate family.
label: ['Restatement or Paraphrasing']

text: usr: Hello, I've been really depressed lately and feel like there isn't anything I can do to break this feeling. sys(Question): Can you tell me what happened? usr: November before Covid started I was diagnoses with CRPS (its a nerve issue that causes immense pain) and had to stop doing my activities like dance, then when Covid hit last March and we all had to isolate I have not been able to interact with people outside my immediate family. sys(Restatement or Paraphrasing): So you suffered from a nerve issue pain and not being able to do the activities you like to do before Covid. It just seems like everyone was happy to find different ways to stay in touch when the lockdown all first started but the longer it goes on the less everyone seems to be trying to connect.

text: usr: Hello, I've been really depressed lately and feel like there isn't anything I can do to break this feeling. sys(Question): Can you tell me what happened? usr: November before Covid started I was diagnoses with CRPS (its a nerve issue that causes immense pain) and had to stop doing my activities like dance, then when Covid hit last March and we all had to isolate I have not been able to interact with people outside my immediate family. sys(Restatement or Paraphrasing): So you suffered from a nerve issue pain and not being able to do the activities you like to do before Covid. Plus Covid made u not able to social with other people. Is that correct? usr: Yes that is correct sys(Reflection of feelings): I feel isolated as well after long time quarantine. It's like living alone in the forest. usr: I know I'm not alone and that's what makes it hard to reach out, because I don't want people to think that I think my problems are worse then there's. It just seems like everyone was happy to find different ways to stay in touch when the lockdown all first started but the longer it goes on the less everyone seems to be trying to connect. sys(Reflection of feelings, Others): I bet there are lots of people feel the same as you do. But they are afraid of sharing the negative emotion to others as you do. It seems that you don't want to bother others. You seem a very thoughtful person. usr: I just don't know what to do about it anymore Yes, I don't like to bother others or let other people down sys(Affirmation and Reassurance, Others, Providing Suggestions): That will give yourself too much emotion burden for sure. Have you visited a physician for suggestion of your pain relief? Maybe yoga will be a more gentle way to replace dancing. What do you think? usr: It is a lot, I'm used to being the person that everyone comes to for help, but I am not very good at asking for help myself. I have seen a doctor and they started my new medicine regimen but unfortunately there is no cure for this disease. I was going to physical therapy but finished that right as Covid started. Plus it does get better as the weather gets warmer so the winter has been hard, really looking forward to spring and summer for a little relief sys(Others): I'm sorry to hear that no good medicine for your issue rite now. usr: I'd be open to doing Yoga once things open back up, but having this disease puts me in a high risk category so my interaction outside the home still has to remain limited until we develop some heard immunity. sys(Providing Suggestions, Others): I know. Sunshine is always best cure for a better mood. Did you try to maybe walk or drive around your neighborhood for some fresh air? Oh, then drive around might be the only option usr: I'm hoping to get out and go for walks once the weather warms up, unfortunately right now there is still some snow on the ground and it's not quite warn yet being in the northeast sys(Others): Ye. You did the right choice. Safety is always the first concern usr: I did take walks along the path in our development last summer so the cabin fever wasn't as bad as it seems to be with all the snow that basically kept me inside all of february sys(Others, Providing Suggestions): Does where you live have a online social activity group on FB or an app called Neighbors? That could be a good way to communicate with others in a safe way. usr: The local FB group is only full of everyone complaining about everyone else (seems when everyone is home things seem to get on peoples nerves more so then when people could get away from home consistently) but I've never heard of the app Neighbors, I'll have to look into that. sys(Providing Suggestions): Give that a try. Maybe you will meet some friends there. usr: I will definitely have to look into that sys(Others): Sounds great. I'm glad you didn't give up seeking for solutions to make yourself feel better usr: Getting someone else's perspective helps because like you recommending that app, there are things I don't know about out there so I appreciate that.
label: ['Others']

text: sys(Question): What is going on today usr: I'm feeling really down about my breakup sys(Restatement or Paraphrasing): \So you have had a breakup recently and you are feeling down about it usr: Yes. In my experience at times we need to be single for self growth and I have found that personal growth usual thrives when I am single. usr: That's what I hope for. I just can't get over missing my partner because they were great to me, I just needed to be alone. sys(Providing Suggestions): I think you are feeling a loss even though you feel that at this time you need to be alone to focus on your own growth. When you had the conversation about this breakup were you honest about why you need the space and that your problem was not with the relationship but with maybe the timing. I think with communication and after growth perhaps by keeping the door open with this person maybe you can have some sort of relationship in the future even if its friendship or maybe more. You are doing what is right for yourself at the given time usr: I did get the chance to explain my reasons a few days after the breakup. They needed space because it was hard going from being in a relationship to being friends in a matter of days. I guess I'll just have to continue working on myself and see how things go sys(Affirmation and Reassurance): Focusing on yourself sounds like the best thing you can do. I am completely unaware.We haven't had any argument of late so i am completely clueless.Wish she would just reach out sys(Others): i can imagine it's hard to put those feeling into words when you want to move on. usr: Exactly.Do you know of any online resources that one can use to get through such situations?
label: ['Question']

text: usr: Hi sys(Question): Hello though, how has life been treating you lately? usr: It's been a pretty crazy year. I'm mostly bummed because of my work. sys(Affirmation and Reassurance): It has been a really weird year hasn't it? Don't worry, I think it's been the same for all of us. Would you like to tell me more details? usr: Sure, when covid hit my company did a round of layoffs and also cut everyone else's pay by 10%... I was bummed but I kind of understood because I knew our business would be impacted by closures. I found out recently that my boss (the VP) is intentionally making our impact seem worse so he can keep our salaries reduced and overall cost lower so that he can get a higher bonus next year.
label: ['Reflection of feelings', 'Question']

He's the VP there isn't anyone I can go to above him

label: ['Self-disclosure']

text: sys(Question): Hi, how are you doing? usr: Hi, I'm ok. How are you? sys(Question): Not bad, it's a peaceful night. Anything in particular you'd like to talk about? usr: That's great. My job refused my request to continue to work from home. So I was pretty much forced to go into a school where the cases are growing.
label: ['Restatement or Paraphrasing']

text: sys(Question): Hi, how are you doing? usr: Hi, I'm ok. How are you? sys(Question): Not bad, it's a peaceful night. Anything in particular you'd like to talk about? usr: That's great. So I was pretty much forced to go into a school where the cases are growing. sys(Restatement or Paraphrasing): I imagine that's very overwhelming and stressful to think about. Are there at least some type of protocols and protection in place for your well-being? usr: Just to make sure I'm wearing my mask, washing my hands, and social distancing. Which is not enough. There are more and more teachers getting infected and I just feel it a matter of time before it my turn. I fear that I will bring this home to my family and I will not survive it. I have pre existing conditions.
label: ['Restatement or Paraphrasing', 'Others']

text: sys(Question): Hello there, how are you doing today? usr: I am doing well. My marijuana consumption today has been less than what it has been for the last week. sys(Question): Well that is good. Are you trying to come off it completely? usr: Absolutely not. I'm not even in California yet, where I know my usage will explode. It's just difficult managing the realities of quarantine with the effects of the marijuana sys(Restatement or Paraphrasing): Well, do you worry about your consumption? If you don't I don't see it as a problem :) usr: Yes, because of the financial strain it places on me and my wife, who is also a regular user. sys(Information): Ah yes, it is not cheap. I am not sure how much to suggest as it's not legal in my country :) usr: It was recently legalized in our state. My wife and I were actually one of the first people in line to buy it legally last year, before the pandemic. It is a major part of our lives. sys(Information): I am in the UK. It's sort of a grey area ... police won't really do anything but you can't buy it over the counter usr: One of the best things about legalization has been the expurgation of criminal records for incarcerated people jailed on marijuana charges. I'm very grateful that these atrocities have been rectified at least partially. sys(Self-disclosure): Yes I would be too. Even twenty five years ago in my student days it was rare for anyone to be prosecuted for pot. The US seems to be really strict on it tho usr: It varies, state by state, depending on which party is governing. Which you of course have a version of in the UK. Mayoral elections were today yeah? sys(Self-disclosure): They were but I didn't pay much attention :) I vote in the Generals and the locals but that's all . usr: Oh, well, I'm sorry to hear that. I think participation in local governance is actually the most achievable path for change, but perhaps how it's structured where you are, it wouldn't really matter much if you participated. I guess mayorals are only technically local, not like parliamentary elections sys(Others): If I were in London or a major city I'd vote for Mayor. I am in a rural area and we don't have one :D. I vote for local councillors tho usr: Oh, I take it to mean that you are anti-Khan? If you feel like you'd need to vote for mayor in London sys(Self-disclosure): I like Khan :) usr: Jeremy Corbyn, no surrender? sys(Self-disclosure): I like him too lol. usr: You sound like someone I'd like to smoke a spliff with In a moderated manner of course, in relevance to the topic I opened with sys(Information): But I don't get to vote for London mayor. Only if I were a London resident or nearby would I (sorry for tortured syntax) usr: Prescriptive grammar is fascism, use whatever words in whatever order you like Ironic given that I just watched My Fair Lady the other day sys(Self-disclosure): Haha I don't indulge these days, except for once in a blue moon :P usr: You've got those weird drug shops in the UK, with synthetics and all that sys(Self-disclosure): Not where I am :( All we have here is sheep and cows. usr: Let me guess - north/eastern UK? sys(Self-disclosure): North West but close :) usr: I have a slightly deeper knowledge of the UK than most Americans. I binged Derry Girls in 2 days so my expertise is almost professorial here sys(Others, Others): haha! I am not touching that one :) usr: It's a good series but yeah if you don't skew younger demographic wise I could see why you'd avoid it. You more of a Last Tango In Halifax type? Don't even watch the Circle? Only Connect? sys(Information): I don't think Derry people would like being referred to as part of the UK ;) usr: True that But, you know Legally
label: ['Self-disclosure']

text: usr: Hello sys(Question): hello,what is on your mind today usr: I feel bad putting this on your shoulders, maybe you can help sys(Question): i have big shoulders! whats on your mind? usr: I'm just struggling a lot to find the motivation to do anything at all, even the most basic of things Sometimes I get very intense feelings of sadness and just want to drop everything I'm doing, like I can't do anything more sys(Reflection of feelings, Question): i think a lot of people are feeling that way these past few months. do you think it is covid related? not sickness, more depression usr: Yes that's very true, depression is probably hitting people the worst right now sys(Affirmation and Reassurance): its becoming a new normal lol usr: No I've been fighting depression since I was probably like 12 years old, it first really hit me when I moved from where I was living all my life and lost all my friends and I was terrified Now I'm 29 But covid definitely plays a factor sys(Self-disclosure, Restatement or Paraphrasing): a few months ago i was feeling the same way. i dont have health insurance but googled and found some online docturs. i got to see a doc and get on antidepressants for less than a hundred covid plays a factor in EVERYTHING ugh usr: So you had the therapy session online with them via webcam or you found them online first then went to see them in person Yeah covid is doing damage in more ways than one sys(Self-disclosure): all online! :) meds shipped to my door. i love it! usr: Wow that's great sys(Others): theres a free site called 7 cups that does free peer to peer couseling too. its good when i have a lot on my mind usr: I would have to do it in person, I don't want people I live with to hear about all my pathetic mental problems Oh 7 cups, I had an account there and met a really nice girl there that was helping me and she was living with an abusive family at the same time, its crazy but now I can't access that account anymore, I'm so sad about that I think it says the account doesn't exist when I try to login now sys(Question): can you make a new one? usr: Sure I guess I'll have to do that but I really wanted to get back into that account, don't want to lose contact with that girl that was helping me sys(Others): cerebral is that one site with the cheap docs usr: do you mean um....cheap med? cerebral seems to be an antidepressant when i googled sys(Others): check the website q and a usr: oh wait nevermind i spoke too soon sys(Others): for cups maybe thers a contact you can email to try to regain access usr: Yeah definitely, I should try contacting their support to try and restore my account sys(Others, Affirmation and Reassurance): they are doing so much things now, you just gotta get on google and see whats out there! i think you are going to be okay, there are definately tough times but you seem to have a grip on knowing what you need. that is great usr: Yeah, I gotta do therapy thats a must and I think it has to be in person so I can try to let some of it out with someone face to face.......but that's going to be very hard, to trust someone and open up about everything because its not just depression Online is convenient but its just too much going on sys(Affirmation and Reassurance): i agree, just with all the covid crap i know it can be hard to get a face to face! :) usr: Right...
label: ['Affirmation and Reassurance', 'Question']

How can I help you today? usr: I am having such a hard time falling asleep at night....I toss and turn and cannot shut my mind off sys(Restatement or Paraphrasing): It seems you are having hard time to fall asleep. Hope I get it right? usr: yes that's right. my mind just races thinking about problems it seems. I am irritable and frustrated. sys(Others): Is there a specific thing or task which is bothering you for long? usr: I worry about my daughter, she has addictions. I never know if she is okay or not, she doesn't call me very often and is hard to get a hold of. sys(Affirmation and Reassurance): It must be a tough time for you and is a enough reason to not getting good sleep. despite of it you should need a complete rest . usr: Have you any suggestions to help me get to sleep easier? I have tried meditation, but it doesn't seem to help much. sys(Reflection of feelings): I feels like you are having less energy and feel tired due to lack of sleep. Try to follow a particular schedule and u can put soothing music before bed. It might calm you down and make you sleep. usr: That's a good idea I can try that. My bedtimes are kind of mixed up, maybe setting a particular schedule will help, I'll try that sometimes i go to be early, sometimes late, maybe that is screwing me up sys(Self-disclosure): When I have sleeping problem, I take warm shower. It help me a lot. usr: good idea, i could try that sys(Information): As far as I know if we follow a particular time to go to bed eventually We start feeling sleepy at that time or body adapt it. usr: oh ok, that makes sense i wish my daughter lived closer so i can check on her, she is in another city which makes it hard i worry ok well thankyou for your help sys(Providing Suggestions): I can understand how hard it is for you. But nothing stays same. I wish your daughter will come out of it soon and wishing her success. Meditation can help you too. Before sleeping you can concentrate on your breath. usr: I appreciate your suggestions and will give them a try. The warm shower sounds like a really good idea. Thankyou so much. are you a parent?

text: sys(Others): Hello. I am in bad mood. sys(Question): What's wrong? usr: This work from home tension and cant go out with my family and parties It makes me depressed and cant bear this pathedic situation sys(Affirmation and Reassurance, Question, Providing Suggestions): I understand. I, too, am struggling with COVID-19. It's going to be difficult not to see family during the holidays. We'll get through this, though, don't you think. Have you spent time trying to communicate with friends and family online or by messaging and telephone? Maybe there is a way to find ways to have fun online with your friends and family. We actually played games together recently. Is that something you could do to reconnect? usr: I am fully occupied with my job. This software field sucks me. Even weekends also they are expecting to work with offshore people I dont find the time to spend with my partner and kids sys(Providing Suggestions): Is there any way you could talk to your supervisor about achieving a better work life balance? usr: Yeah! Good Idea, I ll make a call with my Manager once It could be better to have vacation for a week sys(Reflection of feelings, Self-disclosure): It sounds like that could make a big difference in changing things for you. You just need a better work/life balance to straighten things out. I had a similar experience in the past, and talking with my manager about time off reinvigorated me. usr: Exactly. Please suggest me any idea to spend my time with my family and away from this work pressure Sounds good! I ll arrange a conversation with my head then sys(Providing Suggestions): With COVID-19, it may limit your options, but you could decide which activities you would collectively enjoy the most, and try to do them as often as possible together. usr: Absolutely, then i ll help my family with household chores and make them free Then we have some quality time to spend together!
label: ['Restatement or Paraphrasing', 'Question']

No one is here to chat with. even after being matched. Ridiculous. hello????? hello? no other messages except my own are showing up. sys(Question): Sorry, I had a bad connection. Hello, what can I help you with? usr: Hi. i wasn't sure anyone was there. i left my job about three months after 8 years. haven't found another one. trying to find one has been challenging sys(Restatement or Paraphrasing): Just be clear, you're worried about finding a new job? usr: well, yeah. in the middle of a pandemic, and being in a new town. all of that has been really hard. and stressful sys(Affirmation and Reassurance): That is a difficult position to be in. It is a hard time, but there's always a way to persevere. usr: yeah... i don't know ... i'm not sleeping well because i'm so worried sys(Reflection of feelings): I could imagine that being a constant worry. I understand how you may feel. usr: thanks for trying to understand it just seems pretty hopeless sys(Self-disclosure, Providing Suggestions): No problem. I am encountering a similar situation, looking for a well suited job. Have you tried looking in to new career fields that have always interested you? usr: Yeah, I am looking in a variety of fields not much out there that is remote sys(Information): There are a lot of jobs in technology where the only requirement is learning a few courses, such as programming. usr: that would be cool. i really enjoy tech sys(Information): It would be nice to work in a field that you also enjoy! usr: yes it would. just don't have much energy to keep turning in cover letters and resumes. sys(Providing Suggestions): It can seem hopeless right now, but think about how you felt when you were in a better position. usr: yah thats true you have any ideas on how to be less anxious sys(Self-disclosure): That helps me balance things out in my head sometimes. Sometimes we get stuck. It happens. usr: yeah, stuck is a good description
label: ['Providing Suggestions', 'Others']

text: usr: Hello, is someone there? sys(Others): Hello, my name is Jonathan. May I ask who I am speaking to today? usr: Hi Jonathan, I'm Keri. sys(Others): Hi Keri. How are you today? usr: I'm feeling a little bit down today. I've been feeling a little bit down a lot lately. sys(Information): Oh no. I'm sorry to hear that. What do you think would be the cause of you feeling down lately? usr: My ex-husband is moved in with his new girlfriend. They might get married. sys(Information): Oh Keri, that must feel awful. Was it a recent separation between you two? usr: He started dating a few months after we split up. I don't know if this is the only person he's dated but I think so. He really moved on quick. Hi, are you still there? sys(Self-disclosure): Yeah I understand what you're going through. I was in a similar position not too long ago. I had a hard time wrapping my head around how fast my ex could move on from what we had. How does it make you feel that he's trying to start a new relationship so soon after yours? usr: It makes me feel like he didn't learn anything from our relationship or like he thinks he's better than me because he has someone new and I don't. I'm trying to take some time and be alone and be okay with being alone, which is good I think, but sometimes I feel really really lonely too. Like maybe I won't ever find anyone.
label: ['Providing Suggestions']

I think you're doing the right thing in waiting and learning to love yourself before you can open up and love another. usr: Thank you! Exactly. But it is scary. I am guessing from your name that you identify as male (please forgive me if that is incorrect), so you might not understand what it feels like to be an older woman when your ex starts dating someone a lot younger. Men only get better and more desirable with age, not so for women.

Looking to him to help with your problems and actually listening to his words would really alleviate some of the stress that is so draining usr: I agree that God is our ultimate guide and helper in all this.He will never forsake us no matter what.I will definitely turn to him at this time to seek for his guidance and with faith He will see me through.
label: ['Affirmation and Reassurance']

text: usr: I am feeling depressed sys(Question): Can you tell me more about your feelings? usr: I feel lost and lonely,i do not know what to do sys(Question): When did these feelings come about usr: They came about when i lost my job in August of this year sys(Restatement or Paraphrasing): I can understand where your coming from with that, especially since this pandemic occurred usr: Yes,finances have especially been very tight sys(Reflection of feelings): it seems like this could be overwhelming to you and trying to figure out the right path to go forward usr: It is,have you ever encountered such a situation in your life? sys(Self-disclosure): I can relate to you in this situation 100% and if it wasnt for me stepping out on faith and opening my own practice, I wouldnt be here now. usr: How did you snap out of the situation,did you have some savings? sys(Information): Always putting money aside when able, and doing lots of research about first time businesses gave a lot of insights. Have you tried to look into things like that yourself? usr: Yes,i have been researching a lot too but it is difficult given that i have been surviving on the savings i had.Also it is very difficult to get a loan currently. sys(Question): That I do understand as well. This pandemic has made it hard for everyone. Are you a parent with any little ones by chance? usr: Yes,i have two children,5 and 9 year olds sys(Providing Suggestions): So here is some information that I have in my files to help others during this time. There is self-help.org that is labeled as being a self help during these times. There is also websites that i used like offerup and PoshMark where I was able to start selling some of my belongings to constantly bring in funds. Also try to google "How to become a first time business owner" and see if any of this information helps you and your family. usr: That is very helpful of you.I have been wandering all over the internet lost and not knowing where to find help from.I will definitely check this out and make good use of them.Did you also get any funds from anyone? sys(Providing Suggestions): I know that it can be hard and frustrating during this time, but you have to remain focused for your family and stay strong because I am sure they look up to you. With myself I did have to go to a lot of friends and family, but my faith and my blessings came from God. Looking to him to help with your problems and actually listening to his words would really alleviate some of the stress that is so draining usr: I agree that God is our ultimate guide and helper in all this.He will never forsake us no matter what.I will definitely turn to him at this time to seek for his guidance and with faith He will see me through. sys(Affirmation and Reassurance): Just keep your eyes on the prize because this means that HE has something bigger in store for you! usr: True,you have been very helpful and i appreciate you taking the time to talk to me
label: ['Affirmation and Reassurance']

text: usr: Hello I am very sad today. My partner is cheating on me. sys(Restatement or Paraphrasing): Cheating on you? usr: Yes. With another woman. sys(Question, Question): How do you know that your partner is cheating on you? Did he tell you that he is? usr: I was told by a customer at work. I do not know this person well, yet they knew the person he was cheating on me with. He will not admit it himself. sys(Affirmation and Reassurance, Restatement or Paraphrasing, Question): I am sorry if your partner is cheating. So, your partner denies the charge of cheating? Are you and your partner married? usr: Yes. He says the person who told me is lying. We are not married but we live together. sys(Question): How long have you been in a relationship with your man? usr: 2 years sys(Restatement or Paraphrasing): So, 2 years should be long enough to know if your partner has been cheating. usr: What do you mean exactly? sys(Question): Are you someone who trusts people? I think that most men would fess up about it. usr: I guess all people are different. I generally trust people easily. sys(Question): Does he show affection to you? If he is adamant about loving you, then, it may be false allegations. usr: That is true. He is but, has been distant lately. sys(Self-disclosure): I have had coworkers lie and be jealous that I have a good relationship with my partner. usr: Do you think maybe it was a rumor started by someone who could be jealous? sys(Question): Ash your partner if he loves you enough to propose marriage. If he says no, then ask him why. usr: That is a good point. sys(Affirmation and Reassurance, Affirmation and Reassurance): Yes, workers can be a real problem and can make up stories about people. Slander in the work place happens. Unfortunately, lies and rumors are just that. usr: I am not sure if I am okay with giving him an ultimatum. We are still young and although I love being in a relationship, I am unsure about marriage. But I appreciate your suggestions and you make a great point about the workplace being hostile sys(Affirmation and Reassurance): Sure, I understand. usr: I should trust my partner more than any random person. sys(Restatement or Paraphrasing, Affirmation and Reassurance): Yes, the workplace is not like home life. Yes, trust matters. usr: But every time i bring it up, he tries to change the subject. How should I approach him to communicate better? sys(Information): I would see if he wants to spend time doing things like volunteering after work. If he says yes, or is excited, that is a good sign that he wants to be with you....even after work. usr: okay! that is a good idea. Maybe I can research something and see if there is anything new we can do together. sys(Providing Suggestions, Providing Suggestions): Find things that he has in common or energize the relationship. Yes, ask him if he wants to learn to swing dance or take skiing lessons or volunteer for Habitat for Humanity. usr: That is a good point. It is just hard to go on with the relationship when I feel I do not know the whole truth and there is little discussion or reassurance. sys(Affirmation and Reassurance, Question): You have done your part, but if he wants to show you affection on a regular basis, that is a good sign. How old are the both of you? usr: Okay. I will keep that in mind. text: usr: Hi there, I badly need someone to talk with! sys(Question): hi whats on your mind today usr: My partner left me after fifteen years and I simply do not know what to do. sys(Reflection of feelings): wow. that had to come as a shock. when did you find out usr: Things had not been going well for a while but I had not realised just how bad it would be. sys(Question): i'm so sorry to hear that. how long ago did they leave? usr: About two weeks. I have barely left the house since then. I just do not feel that I can go on. sys(Question): not leaving the house is the new normal for many of us right now. are you not leaving because you have nowhere to go or because you are feeling bad usr: I think mostly the latter. I just do not want to face the world any more . I feel that everyone must know that I've been dumped and be laughing at me. sys(Affirmation and Reassurance): you havve already made it two weeks by going one day at a time usr: I did not really have any choice though . I do not see any future for myself now that we are separated. sys(Information): do you know brene brown and her work usr: No I do not, who is that? sys(Providing Suggestions): she studies vuneraility and shame. please look for her TED talk and there's a great youtube video on empathy usr: Thank you , I will. Right now I really need some sort of emotional support. I feel that the last fifteen years of my life have been a waste. sys(Information, Information): i bring her up because what i sounds like is that you are feeling embarrassed because your partner made a choice that wasn't you in reality the choice they made wasn't about you, it was about them usr: It is not so much that - it is that I feel that I dedicated the majority of my adult life to this relationship and now there is nothing left. sys(Affirmation and Reassurance): you are left and you are enough. even if you dont feel like it right now you are enough usr: I really do not feel like it right now. What was the last fifteen years all about? I wanted to have children with him and he refused but now I hear he is expecting a baby with another woman. sys(Affirmation and Reassurance): a relationship is part of who you are. it isn't you usr: But it is very difficult to try to strike out on my own again and I do not know if I even want to. sys(Providing Suggestions): it is hard. it sucks. but the voyage through the suck is going to be better for you than you may realize right now usr: But I feel that I am facing middle age on my own and I really do not want to do that. sys(Providing Suggestions): you have survived 14 days without a bad relationship. keep on doing that day by day and before you know it, you will be on the other side of the bad feelings usr: What happens if I just can't ever get over it though? Right now it's hard to see any sort of way through these feelings. sys(Information): yes, middle age is scary, but there are so many things you can do. ageism is out usr: I feel I might have missed out on my chance to have a family of my own though, because I waited fifteen years and my partner would not go for that. sys(Providing Suggestions): please watch the cartoon animals and brene brown on youtube talk about empathy. find one of your friends who has been through the suck and let them help you find your path out. usr: Most of my friends seem to be very happily coupled up right now. They are sympathetic but they do not really understand. sys(Self-disclosure): i had an emergency ovary removal in my early 30s and didn't know if i woudl be able to have children. my doctor told me that the most important thing i could do was to be healthy becuse a healthy mother was what i could give my children even if i adopted them usr: That sounds like very good advice from both you and your doctor. It is a difficult thing to have to confront though. I really do appreciate the fact that you have taken the time to talk honestly with me.
label: ['Providing Suggestions']

What makes you anxious about coming home late? usr: I am walking sys(Affirmation and Reassurance, Question): Oh I understand Have you thought about other ways to get back home besides walking? usr: Yes, trying to find a ride but the bus also stops going Maybe I could call an Uber home sys(Providing Suggestions): If that would help you ease your anxiety, I think it would be a good solution to consider! usr: I think the stress outside of the job is also contributing sys(Question): What makes you anxious about walking home late? usr: Like I am having relationship issues, in a long distance relationship and I jsut came home and have been missing him and I am torn between the two states Also just safety issues sys(Self-disclosure): Oh I understand about the safety issues, I too cannot stand walking alone at night usr: What do you do for safety? sys(Question): How long have you been in this long-distance relationship? usr: Two months but we've known each other way longer than that sys(Self-disclosure): I try to avoid walking and either ask someone to come and get me, or take an Uber or the bus or my own car! usr: I think the Uber is a good idea. I don't have many friends who would be up at midnight for the ride or be open to it. sys(Providing Suggestions, Question): That's good to consider! I think that if money is an issue right now, it will become easier as you get your paychecks and will feel less guilty about Ubering home For your relationship, you've known this person for a long time before you got together? usr: I don't feel too guilty about the Uber, mostly worried about affording it to be honest Yeah we went to middle school together sys(Others): I'm sorry, that's what I meant, affording it (language issues my bad) usr: Oh it's okay my bad! sys(Question): Ok so you've known him for a long time, you two feel comfortable with communicating your feelings and worries together? usr: Yes sys(Question): Ok that's great! Do you want to tell me more about the issues you are experiencing with him so we can understand a bit more the root of the stress? usr: Well mostly he'shaving problems affording rent too and I can't help him much and it sucks that I can't help him ata ll sys(Restatement or Paraphrasing): Ah, i get it. So what I'm understanding from this is that you feel helpless in this situation and that's what's making you anxious? usr: Yes sys(Question): Can you tell me a little more about how this feeling of helplessness is affecting you personally? usr: It makes me feel sad and lost. I'm afraid he's going to lose his apartment
label: ['Question']

text: sys(Question): Hi, how can I help you today? usr: I am having problems because I need money and the only jobs I can find are outside of the hours I need to work and I'm having anxiety sys(Affirmation and Reassurance, Question): Oh, that is anxiety-provoking... How long have you b een searching? usr: Yes, I called a staffing agency and they matched me with a job but I will still be coming home late So I am trying to put in applications elsewhere as wlel Well* sys(Affirmation and Reassurance, Question): It's great that you are putting out applications elsewhere as well! What makes you anxious about coming home late? usr: I am walking sys(Affirmation and Reassurance, Question): Oh I understand Have you thought about other ways to get back home besides walking? usr: Yes, trying to find a ride but the bus also stops going Maybe I could call an Uber home sys(Providing Suggestions): If that would help you ease your anxiety, I think it would be a good solution to consider! usr: I think the stress outside of the job is also contributing sys(Question): What makes you anxious about walking home late? usr: Like I am having relationship issues, in a long distance relationship and I jsut came home and have been missing him and I am torn between the two states Also just safety issues sys(Self-disclosure): Oh I understand about the safety issues, I too cannot stand walking alone at night usr: What do you do for safety? sys(Question): How long have you been in this long-distance relationship? usr: Two months but we've known each other way longer than that sys(Self-disclosure): I try to avoid walking and either ask someone to come and get me, or take an Uber or the bus or my own car! usr: I think the Uber is a good idea. I don't have many friends who would be up at midnight for the ride or be open to it. sys(Providing Suggestions, Question): That's good to consider! I think that if money is an issue right now, it will become easier as you get your paychecks and will feel less guilty about Ubering home For your relationship, you've known this person for a long time before you got together? usr: I don't feel too guilty about the Uber, mostly worried about affording it to be honest Yeah we went to middle school together sys(Others): I'm sorry, that's what I meant, affording it (language issues my bad) usr: Oh it's okay my bad! sys(Question): Ok so you've known him for a long time, you two feel comfortable with communicating your feelings and worries together? usr: Yes sys(Question): Ok that's great! Do you want to tell me more about the issues you are experiencing with him so we can understand a bit more the root of the stress? usr: Well mostly he'shaving problems affording rent too and I can't help him much and it sucks that I can't help him ata ll sys(Restatement or Paraphrasing): Ah, i get it. I want it to help support me. sys(Affirmation and Reassurance): Ok that's good to hear! usr: Yeah, I just want to be able to have my own stuff again. I've been relying on doing surveys online. sys(Reflection of feelings): From what I'm understanding, you're not only feeling anxious and pressure in your own personal life but you're heart is also wherever he is right now and living whatever stress and pressure he is living as well, and that is putting yourself in a very anxiety-provoking position usr: Yes sys(Affirmation and Reassurance): I understand that, especially given the current pandemic situation, it isn't easy at all usr: Also being far away from him sucks sys(Question): Are you guys FaceTiming or communicating at all other than by texts? usr: You are being very helpful by the way thank you We aren't FaceTiming. Or was there something else that happened that weekend? usr: Just leaving him sys(Providing Suggestions): Have you guys thought about scheduling date nights through FaceTime? usr: I think he would but he hasn't been feeling really good about his appearance lately I asked and that's what he told me sys(Self-disclosure): I understand that completely, I can relate a lot usr: Same sys(Providing Suggestions): If it makes any difference, my partner and I have been doing date nights where we would dress up, put make up on and do our hair and everything as if we were going to the restaurant, and even if it is through Facetime or whenever we see each other in real life, it helps not only with our own self-esteem but also our relationship usr: That is very cute sys(Providing Suggestions): Maybe you could open the discussion with your boyfriend, tell him that you have a date planned over Facetime and you want him to order his favorite dinner, take a shower, do his hair and dress up real nice usr: I don't know if he would be open to that but I could try He isn't really the romantic type sys(Question): You have been friends for a long time before getting together, you guys are comfortable with each other, right? text: sys(Question): Hi, how can I help you today? usr: I am having problems because I need money and the only jobs I can find are outside of the hours I need to work and I'm having anxiety sys(Affirmation and Reassurance, Question): Oh, that is anxiety-provoking... How long have you b een searching? usr: Yes, I called a staffing agency and they matched me with a job but I will still be coming home late So I am trying to put in applications elsewhere as wlel Well* sys(Affirmation and Reassurance, Question): It's great that you are putting out applications elsewhere as well! What makes you anxious about coming home late? usr: I am walking sys(Affirmation and Reassurance, Question): Oh I understand Have you thought about other ways to get back home besides walking? usr: Yes, trying to find a ride but the bus also stops going Maybe I could call an Uber home sys(Providing Suggestions): If that would help you ease your anxiety, I think it would be a good solution to consider! usr: I think the stress outside of the job is also contributing sys(Question): What makes you anxious about walking home late? usr: Like I am having relationship issues, in a long distance relationship and I jsut came home and have been missing him and I am torn between the two states Also just safety issues sys(Self-disclosure): Oh I understand about the safety issues, I too cannot stand walking alone at night usr: What do you do for safety? sys(Question): How long have you been in this long-distance relationship? usr: Two months but we've known each other way longer than that sys(Self-disclosure): I try to avoid walking and either ask someone to come and get me, or take an Uber or the bus or my own car! usr: I think the Uber is a good idea. I don't have many friends who would be up at midnight for the ride or be open to it. sys(Providing Suggestions, Question): That's good to consider! I think that if money is an issue right now, it will become easier as you get your paychecks and will feel less guilty about Ubering home For your relationship, you've known this person for a long time before you got together? usr: I don't feel too guilty about the Uber, mostly worried about affording it to be honest Yeah we went to middle school together sys(Others): I'm sorry, that's what I meant, affording it (language issues my bad) usr: Oh it's okay my bad! sys(Question): Ok so you've known him for a long time, you two feel comfortable with communicating your feelings and worries together? usr: Yes sys(Question): Ok that's great! Do you want to tell me more about the issues you are experiencing with him so we can understand a bit more the root of the stress? usr: Well mostly he'shaving problems affording rent too and I can't help him much and it sucks that I can't help him ata ll sys(Restatement or Paraphrasing): Ah, i get it. I want it to help support me. sys(Affirmation and Reassurance): Ok that's good to hear! usr: Yeah, I just want to be able to have my own stuff again. text: sys(Question): Good day, how are you doing? usr: Not too well. I have been depessed because of our state shut down and today an old friend from unior high school passed.
label: ['Reflection of feelings', 'Question']

text: sys(Question): Good day, how are you doing? usr: Not too well. I have been depessed because of our state shut down and today an old friend from unior high school passed. sys(Reflection of feelings, Question): Sorry to hear that. I absolutely understand, it's been hard on most people having to deal with the current state of affairs and losing people. Do you think things will improve? usr: Thank you. I know we are all in the same predicament. I think things will improve, but not for a year or more.
label: ['Self-disclosure', 'Question']

text: sys(Question): Good day, how are you doing? usr: Not too well. I lost a teacher some time ago and I've been thinking a lot about when things might improve. A year seems plausible. Since it's so hard, are there things you think you can do to cheer yourself up? usr: A year is a long time when y A year is a long time when you are 76 years old. I just want to enjoy the rest of our lives - my husband and me - and travel until we can't enjoy it any longer.
